channel.title: Protocols for Future, Large-Scale & Diverse Network Transports
channel.description: Recent content on Protocols for Future, Large-Scale & Diverse Network Transports

item.description: PFLDnet 2007 -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- ABOUT LOS ANGELES AND MARINA DEL REY Useful Links. Marina Del Rey: Official Visitors and Convention Bureau More tourist information in Wikipedia Access to Marina Del Rey Los Angeles: in Lonely Planet guide (plus Fast facts and electrical plugs) Visitors and Convention Bureau Public transport, Airports and Beaches

PFLDnet 2007 Getting there -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- Map Getting to PFLDnet Workshop venue PFLDnet2007 will be on the 11th floor of the ISI building, 4676 Admiralty Way, Marina Del Rey, CA. Access to Marina Del Rey from Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) Super Shuttle LAX is the closest international airport to Marina Del Rey, on approximately 4 miles away.

PFLDnet 2007- Call for papers -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- Call for Papers Abstract Submission now closed. Abstract Submission now closed. Future networks will increasingly contain high bandwidth, high delay paths. Protocols for fast, long distance networks will have to expand from experimental testbeds and into the wider world.

PFLDnet 2007 Committees -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- COMMITTEES Co-Chairs: Lachlan Andrew (Caltech - USA) Aaron Falk (ISI - USA) Medy Sanadidi (UCLA - USA) Steering Committee: Aaron Falk (ISI - USA) Katsushi Kobayashi (NICT - JP) Pascale Vicat-Blanc Primet (INRIA - FR) Medy Sanadidi (UCLA - USA) Technical Program Committee: Lachlan Andrew (Caltech - USA) (Co-chair) Doug Leith (Hamilton Institute - IE) (Co-chair) Medy Sanadidi (UCLA - USA) (Co-chair) Mark Allman (ICIR - USA)

PFLDnet 2007 -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- Visit PFLDnet2008, March 5-7, 2008 in Manchester, England! The International Workshop on Protocols for Fast Long-Distance Networks at CERN (PFLDnet2003), Argonne (PFLDnet2004), Lyon (PFLDnet2005) and Nara (PFLDnet2006) were very successful in bringing together many researchers from all over the world including North America, Europe and Asia who are working on these problems.

PFLDnet 2007 -- 7-9 February 2007; Marina Del Rey, CA -- TECHNICAL PROGRAM Prof. R. Srikant of UIUC and Larry Dunn of Cisco will be plenary speakers at PFLDnet2007. For the first time, PFLDnet will host a tutorial. This tutorial will be given by Prof. Steven Low, Professor at Caltech and CEO of FastSoft, with a tentative title of "Flow control theory for practitioners", on the morning of Friday February 9th, 2007 .

PFLDnet 2006 The International Workshop on Protocols for Fast Long-Distance Networks at CERN (PFLDnet2003), Argonne (PFLDnet2004), and in Lyon(PFLDnet2005) were very successful in bringing together many researchers from all over the world including North America, Europe and Asia who are working on these problems. This workshop will continue this tradition, and provide a perfect setting for researchers in this area to exchange ideas and experience.
